result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Alexander Bermudez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant shall not have any violent contact with J.M.S., J.L.S. or J.L.B.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Alexander Bermudez

defendant.name: Bermudez, Nathan Alexander

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nathan Alexander Bermudez in court.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Nathan Alexander Bermudez.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2 & Ct 3; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Defendant Nathan Alexander Bermudez not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Nathan Alexander Bermudez.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel was expecting resolution and does not know why def is not present.  Case to be recalled.
State appears by Atty. Mark Bensen; defendant appears in person with Atty. Jeffrey Jaeger. Hearing scheduled 9/28/2022 at 8:15 AM
No violent contact with JLS, JMS, or JLB. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan Alexander Bermudez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa appeared by video for Nathan Alexander Bermudez. Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. SPD to appoint.  Court sets $1000 signature bond.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of def.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
